title.narrative: 4. Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) IN EMERGENCIES

description.narrative: By 2020, women and children affected by the security crisis have received adequate and coordinated water, hygiene and sanitation assistance, which contributes to Child Health, Children In Urban Settings / Local Governance, Disaster Risk Reduction, Environmental Sustainability, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition, Sanitation, Sanitation (Covid), Water. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, children living in rural areas have improved access to quality water, a healthy environment and sustainable sanitation facilities in communities, in schools, and at health centres.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2020, women and children affected by the security crisis have received adequate and coordinated water, hygiene and sanitation assistance

description.narrative: So far BCO achieved 25% of their annual water targets, 6% of their sanitation target and 40% of their hygiene target in the five priority regions (Centre nord, North, Sahel, Est and Boucle du Mouhoun). For WASH cluster targets, BCO contributed to 37% for water, 44% for sanitation and 51% for hygiene promotion, respectively. The humanitarian development nexus programming was intensified through advocacy efforts. The BCO also continued to lead the WASH cluster contributing significantly to the routine humanitarian program and COVID response. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:30/06/2020
